summary.para: Always when a frame is rendered this viewport ensures that the frame be proportionally scaled to fit the width or height of the window (adding letter or pillarboxing depending on the current size of the window).
This class don't need a camera to work, that is, you can use it independently and project your own camera.
Always when the image is rescaled, the change is stored in the ScalingMatrix that you can use with your camera.
Unless you're working on your own camera class or even want to use this viewport without a camera, avoid calling this freely!
This method will be automatically called within the camera that is using it and also when the window is resized (manually, when toggling fullscreen or maximizing).
